intro: Rhynchospora setacea f. filicula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flatsedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils along stream banks or in swamps. Its flowers are usually inconspicuous, with tiny, three-lobed perianths that are often green or reddish in color. This plant is often found in temperate regions and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
